current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to allow for data collection about
			 military-connected students.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Helping Military Children Succeed in Schools Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Helping Military Children Succeed in Schools Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1111(h)(1)(C) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:1111/ss:h/p:1/sp:C

header.#text: Amendment to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:1111/ss:h/p:1/sp:C/cl:vii

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: by striking the period at the end and inserting
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:1111/ss:h/p:1/sp:C/cl:viii
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:1111/ss:h/p:1/sp:C/cl:viii
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:1116

text.#text:
information regarding the number of military-connected students which, for the
	 purposes of this clause, shall mean students with a parent who serves in
	 the Armed Forces, including the National Guard and Reserve Forces, and information
			 regarding
	 academic achievement for such students, except that such information shall not
	 be used for school or local educational agency accountability purposes under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2259 IS: Helping Military Children Succeed in Schools Act
